result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob James Braun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to sign up for Probation in Jail.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: $268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF10.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to complete 32 session treatment program while the the St. Croix County Jail.
-Defendant to be enrolled in school full-time or employed full-time.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment or therapy.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

supervisions.notes:
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Donald J. Schwab, DF: Jacob James Braun appeared from jail.  Court called.  Set for SEH.  ADA Minser gives recommendation.   Crt orders:

- DE sentenced to 4 years with 2 years I/C and 2 years E/S
- DE has credit for 579 days credit for time served
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
- Not to associate with any known users or sellers of drugs
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- Probation can be transfered to Minnesota
- DE is remanded to the custody of the St. Croix County Sheriff's office to be transfered to Dodge
- 20 days to appeal
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 15, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 15, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: James H. Krave, DF: Jacob James Braun appeared from jail.  Court called at 1:50 p.m. Set for PTC.    There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1.  Set out for SEH.  Bail is continued.
